# Data process

## Cuba

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `sbp`|`dbp`|
|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `Systolic blood pressure of participant at each wave` |`Diastolic blood pressure of participantat at each wave` |
| **Table name** | `sbp` |`dbp` |
| **Units** | `mmHg` |`mmHg` |
| **Missings** |`991 = CAPI/interviewer error` | 
| | `992 = Impute` | `992 = Impute` |
| | `993 = Disable to measure` | `993 = Disable to measure` | 
| | `994 = Not attempt/not done` | `994 = Not attempt/not done` |
| | `995 = Does not answer` | `995 = Does not answer` |
| | `996 = Not applicable`| `996 = Not applicable`| 
| | `997 = Refuse` | `997 = Refuse` |
| | `998 = Do not know` | `998 = Do not know` |
| | `999 = Missing`| `999 = Missing`|
| **Description** |  |  |


```{r assign_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
load(paste0(datafolder,"cuba_w1/sbp.RData"))
load(paste0(datafolder,"cuba_w1/dbp.RData"))
t1066_ah <- merge(sbp, dbp, by = "id")
```

```{r local_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ah$sbp
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3])
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_ah, aes(sbp)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue", data = .%>% filter(!vari %in% miss_values_vector)) + xlab("Systolic Blood Pressure") + ylab("Frequency") 

vari <- t1066_ah$dbp
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3])
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_ah, aes(dbp)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue", data = .%>% filter(!vari %in% miss_values_vector)) + xlab("Diastolic Blood Pressure") + ylab("Frequency") 
```


#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable, first of all, it has to be created two categorical variables as follows:

* dh:
  + `dbp >= 90 into 1`
  + `dbp < 90 into 0`

* sh:
  + `sbp >= 140 into 1`
  + `sbp < 140 into 0`

After that, to compute the harmonized variable from this two variables has to be recoded as follows:

* `if dh = 0 and sh = 0 into 0`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 0 into 1`
* `if dh = 0 and sh = 1 into 1`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_cuba1}
t1066_ah$dh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$dbp, "0:89.99999999=0; 90:900=1")
t1066_ah$sh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$sbp, "0:139.9999999=0; 140:900=1")

t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_ah$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah <- NA
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 0
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 1
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==999 & t1066_ah$sh==999)] <- 999

t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah, labels = c("no hypertension"=0, "hypertension"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(ah))) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency") 
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
```

```{r save_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
ah <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1
save(ah, file = "../RData/cuba_w1/ah.RData")
rm(ah)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable, first of all, it has to be created two categorical variables as follows:

* dh:
  + `dbp >= 90 into 1`
  + `dbp < 90 into 0`

* sh:
  + `sbp >= 140 into 1`
  + `sbp < 140 into 0`

After that, to compute the harmonized variable from this two variables has to be recoded as follows:

* `if dh = 0 and sh = 0 into 0`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 0 into 1`

* `if dh = 1 and sh = 1 into 1`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_RCh1}
t1066_ah$dh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$dbp, "0:89.99999999=0; 90:900=1")
t1066_ah$sh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$sbp, "0:139.9999999=0; 140:900=1")

t1066_ds_RCh_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RCh_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RCh_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RCh_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==999 & t1066_ah$sh==999)] <- 999

t1066_ds_RCh_w1$ah <- labelled(t1066_ds_RCh_w1$ah, labels = c("no hypertension"=0, "hypertension"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable, first of all, it has to be created two categorical variables as follows:

* dh:
  + `dbp >= 90 into 1`
  + `dbp < 90 into 0`

* sh:
  + `sbp >= 140 into 1`
  + `sbp < 140 into 0`

After that, to compute the harmonized variable from this two variables has to be recoded as follows:

* `if dh = 0 and sh = 0 into 0`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 0 into 1`
* `if dh = 0 and sh = 1 into 1`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**


```{r harmo_PR2}
t1066_ah$dh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$dbp, "0:89.99999999=0; 90:900=1")
t1066_ah$sh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$sbp, "0:139.9999999=0; 140:900=1")

t1066_ds_PR_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_ah$id)
t1066_ds_PR_w2$ah <- NA
t1066_ds_PR_w2$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 0
t1066_ds_PR_w2$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 1
t1066_ds_PR_w2$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_PR_w2$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_PR_w2$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==999 & t1066_ah$sh==999)] <- 999

t1066_ds_PR_w2$ah <- labelled(t1066_ds_PR_w2$ah, labels = c("no hypertension"=0, "hypertension"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

## Descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable:




```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}


labelling <- function(l.hds,m.hds){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with categorical data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
    aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
    # Labelling of variables
    label(l.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label
    # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
    l.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
    aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
    # Labelling of categories (for categorical variables, only non-missing values)
    aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
    m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
    rm(aux_object)
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}

# Creation of summary tables for categorical data

summaries <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames){

  # Creation of columns with categories and labels
  t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][2])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][2])[[1]][,4] 
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))
  )
  # Add wave/population names
  names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label",lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}


```
